availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Winslow Dudley (Fayette County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, physician. Virginia native. Son of Elder Ambrose Dudley. Married to Anna Short Dudley. Father of Charles Wilkins Dudley and Anna Dudley Tilford. Educated at Transylvania University. Physician in Fayette County, Kentucky in 1850. Surgeon in Fayette County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 192B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 350.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 47.
